author: Timothy Wu
title: Order Book Based Exchange
description: Currently most popular DEXes employ AMM liquidity pools. This lacks the familiarity of an order book based market for spot and derivatives.

assessments.note: An order book DEX is an application with the potential to address the challenge without a doubt, but the lack of details and proposal planning brings uncertainty to the project in general and to the impact assessment of the proposal on the challenge. I recommend that more details are provided so that the community can make a more informed decision.

start working on a plan and a roadmap to mark your goals and milestones. There's no definition of the idea's success, there's no information on how the solution would actually help solve the problem and there's no information on upcoming challenges and risks

The problem of this proposal is that it remains very abstract about the solution to the presented problem. The proposer should be much more specific about WHY and HOW this approach will really improve liquidity and adaption of ADA/Cardano. I also don't see evidence, if the proposer is really able to execute the solution. Maybe he is, but there is no evidence. The proposal sound more like a vague idea which needs much more planing. The idea itself could be impactful, but as I said, there is much work to do. So a funding in this stage seems to early and the success seems to be very unsure.

Potentially interesting concept - unfortunately it is in a very basic idea format at the moment that hasn't been worked on and hence there isn't enough information that would make it easy to understand utility within Cardano ecosystem or where authors envision this to sit if funded. It would be useful to add more depth to the proposal in order to be able to judge it more effectively and then come back at the later stage.

There is no reasonable plan and the experience related by the proposer doesn't describe whether he has expertise in developing smart contracts or DEXs. I recommend more details about the proposer's skills and professional experience and whether the proposal will be conducted with just one member or a team. Despite the idea to foresee the investigation of technologies for the implementation of a DEX, it is important that some reasonable plan is presented, something that can allow the community to be able to measure the chances of successful implementation.
This proposal is missing substantial information that would lift it from being an idea into actually being a proposal. If has no significant plan, no budget breakdown, no technical docs.

The proposer did not provide an evidence for his experience. I suggest to add links to references. The budgeting is not defined in detail. So it is hard to assess if the amount is reasonable or not. There is also only an idea what to do, but not a detailed description how every step is going to be executed. So I can't really imagine, if the solution really works.

There isn't any sense of budgetary requirements beyond one grand figure. It would be great to understand in better detail what these are, including some references to professional experience. There are no external links that would help us establish validity of claims or review some past work. Adding these would boost credibility greatly.

Little information has been described to check the feasibility of the proposal, considering that the proposal is requesting 25% of the total budget for the challenge and there are no budget details, roadmap, milestones or KPIs it is difficult to guarantee the auditability of the proposal and how it will address the challenge in a relevant way.
Can't audit a plan, when there is no plan.

Since this seems more like a concept at this stage than actual proposal - it would be great if the future version included roadmap and milestone elements to understand where this is headed. Understanding some success metrics and KPis would be useful. There isn't much of that presently. Also - knowing how authors think about associated challenges or risks (if any) would showcase greater validity to community before considering investment. At the current stage - it isn't just yet.

The is no roadmap, no time horizon, no metrics/KPIs. So the community can not assess progress and the success of this proposal. The proposer also doesn't say anything about potential challenges. The whole thing is still not thought out.

solution: To investigate and implement an order book market to trade ADA/native token pairs, where users can participate in a non-custodial manner.
experience:
10+ years building distributed systems
Familiar with event driven methodologies
Proficient in Go, Javascript
